bill.title: Sales tax; levy additional one cent on soft drinks.
bill.description: An Act To Create A New Code Section To Provide For Definitions Of Terms Associated With Imposing An Additional Sales Tax On Soft Drinks; To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose An Additional Sales Tax On Retail Sales Of Soft Drinks In The Amount Of One Cent Per Bottle Containing A Soft Drink; To Provide That This Additional Tax Levy Shall Be Imposed Without Regard To The Size Or Volume Capacity Of The Bottle And Without Regard To Whether The Soft Drink Contains A Caloric Or Noncaloric Sweetener; To Create A New Code Section To Provide For The Creation Of The School Health Disparity Special Fund, Into Which Shall Be Deposited The Collections Of The Additional Sales Tax On Soft Drinks; To Provide That Monies In The Special Fund Shall Be Allocated To Certain School Nurse Programs Located In School Districts Having Students With A Health Disparity When Compared To The Median Health Index Of The School Districts In The State, As Identified By The State Superintendent Of Public Education; To Provide That Those School Districts Shall Use Such Monies For Educational, Environmental And Policy Approaches That Promote Health, Nutrition And Physical Activity; To Provide That The State Auditor And The Commissioner Of Revenue Shall Audit And Establish Rules And Procedures As Necessary To Accomplish The Purposes Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Diversion Of Sales Tax Collections Of This Additional Sales Tax On Soft Drinks Into The School Health Disparity Special Fund; And For Related Purposes.
